author: @JaceHart33
text: So much yet to learn. Thank you for being one of my teachers

author: @Str3tch-u6d
text: Not all reality can be filtered through class struggle. It's dehumanizing to reduce America's struggles down to class antagonisms. It's about respect and recognition as human beings

author: @numbersix8919
text: The comrade professor makes a good point.  The ACP will by necessity incorporate/align with the Black revolutionary path in the US, the final form in action being Fred Hampton's work and thought.

author: @morningstararun6278
text: Professor Carlos well put it. Contradictions drive the society forward, and the contradictions intensified with the rise of the oppressed black people in the plantations, freeing themselves from the south, and appending power to the black proletariat, by becoming a part of it.

author: @victorvelez8664
text: Is a great analysis but I still see United States as a multi ethnic country; Hispanics, blacks whites, natives, asian to name a few, and all have contributed to the formation of this country.

author: @darrelldavis5018
text: Well said. I think this is a very soothing message, especially for  integrationists.   I think this is good because it makes it harder for racists to do high-intensity genocide, rhetoric such as this or George Washington Carver. You lense is sociological and dialectical and not mathematical while maintaining the dialectical necessity(not a fight or a debate). Is Israel an Arab country? Haiti is a poor, war ravaged, and underveloped country, and i will not say the quiet part(all the obligatories that i would not otherwise entertain or dismiss). The thing is, it was not always.   How is the USA with the most christians and the most "White" people by head count, Black? Do we just forget Brazil? WEB Du Bois prior to WWII was a horrible human being.

author: @zackkilgore528
text: Interesting. Counterpoint, Blacks have been constantly utilized by the Pinkertons and Capitalists as both strike-breakers and scab labor to undermine the collective bargaining of the White Working Class. They were able to be utilized in such a fashion because, the reality is, they are not of the nation and frankly are forced into these roles as a means of protection within a nation they are very much alien to. This goes on well into today with the Democratic Party, the Arch Containment Organization of the bourgeoisie, utilizing Patronage networks with certain class traitors within Black Communities as a means of power accumulation. W.E.B. Du Bois *is* a comrade and his analysis is sincerely profound and worthy of any serious socialist to consider. However, the assessment that America is a Black Nation is nakedly false just as it‚Äôs not an Italian, Irish, Chinese, or Ulster Scot nation due to the deprivation and struggle of the underclasses of those communities. It is clear, at least to me, that W.E.B. Du Bois had come to understand this himself which is why he opted to emigrate to an actual Black Nation, that being Ghana wherein he resided until his death. I appreciate your content and I do think you‚Äôre sincere in your Marxist Analysis, however I must maintain that this take is flawed and reeks of Black Nationalism which is inherently as Marxist as White Nationalism. That being not at all.

author: @DiscipleOfHeavyMeta1
text: I don't know, but I do know what has been holding Black Americans back for so long has been their lack of polity, at least in the form of state within the union.

author: @jachymsebes
text: The US isnt a black country. This is another Marxist bonkers theory. Class struggle does not determine a nation, just look at Germany, Japan, Saudi Arabia, Iran, Greece and others. Plus it was not just black community who fought for themselves, hundreds of thousand of Union soldiers died for black freedom and the civil rights act was signed by Johnson who you hate so much. Maybe dont see history through class strugle only, because classes can actually cooperate and not just fight each other

replies.author: @presterjohn1697
replies.text: No actually this is a country where brain dead working class WASP vigorously support policies that preserve the wealth of upper class WASP. Chickens who vote KFC. Stunted morons.

replies.author: @Deondre2026
replies.text: They did not die for black freedom. They died for Union preservation and economic interest divergence between North and South. Emancipation was a partially forced military decision.

replies.author: @jachymsebes
replies.text: ‚Äã@Deondre2026 if you will at least political decision. But tell me, why did the South secceede?

replies.author: @Deondre2026
replies.text: @jachymsebes Because they wanted to expand westward but republicans wanted more whites only free soil for manufacturing. Basically elite infighting.

author: @qsefthukolpmhvfxsza
text:
Ah yes the class struggle in America is primarily about (checks notes) 12-15 percent of the population. The Civil War, like most of American history, was a class struggle for everybody. Reducing it to the color line is foolish and self-defeating, but fundamentally unsurprising for any descendant org of CPUSA. 

You lose any and all credibility to critique the anti-national baizuo when you start tripping over Hegel to justify claims that black Americans are the one true human subject of our country's rich history.
